title: bd_rhapsody
description:
A wrapper for the BD Rhapsody Analysis CWL v1.10.1 pipeline.

The CWL pipeline file is obtained by cloning 'https://bitbucket.org/CRSwDev/cwl/src/master/' and removing all objects with class 'DockerRequirement' from the YML.

This pipeline can be used for a targeted analysis (with `--mode targeted`) or for a whole transcriptome analysis (with `--mode wta`).

* If mode is `"targeted"`, then either the `--reference` or `--abseq_reference` parameters must be defined.
* If mode is `"wta"`, then `--reference` and `--transcriptome_annotation` must be defined, `--abseq_reference` and `--supplemental_reference` is optional.

The reference_genome and transcriptome_annotation files can be generated with the make_reference pipeline.
Alternatively, BD also provides standard references which can be downloaded from these locations:

  - Human: http://bd-rhapsody-public.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/Rhapsody-WTA/GRCh38-PhiX-gencodev29/
  - Mouse: http://bd-rhapsody-public.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/Rhapsody-WTA/GRCm38-PhiX-gencodevM19/

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

mode.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `wta`, choices: ``wta`, `targeted``. Whether to run a whole transcriptome analysis (WTA) or a targeted analysis
mode.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `wta`, choices: ``wta`, `targeted``. Whether to run a whole transcriptome analysis (WTA) or a targeted analysis.

input.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `input.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Path to your read files in the FASTQ
input.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `input.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Path to your read files in the FASTQ.GZ format. You may specify as many R1/R2 read pairs as you want.

reference.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `reference_genome.tar.gz|reference.fasta`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Refence to map to
reference.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `reference_genome.tar.gz|reference.fasta`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Refence to map to. For `--mode wta`, this is the path to STAR index as a tar.gz file. For `--mode targeted`, this is the path to mRNA reference file for pre-designed, supplemental, or custom panel, in FASTA format

transcriptome_annotation.description: Type: `file`, example: `transcriptome.gtf`. Path to GTF annotation file (only for `--mode wta`)
transcriptome_annotation.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `transcriptome.gtf`. Path to GTF annotation file (only for `--mode wta`).

abseq_reference.description: Type: List of `file`, example: `abseq_reference.fasta`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Path to the AbSeq reference file in FASTA format
abseq_reference.help_text: Type: List of `file`, example: `abseq_reference.fasta`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Path to the AbSeq reference file in FASTA format. Only needed if BD AbSeq Ab-Oligos are used.

supplemental_reference.description: Type: List of `file`, example: `supplemental_reference.fasta`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Path to the supplemental reference file in FASTA format
supplemental_reference.help_text: Type: List of `file`, example: `supplemental_reference.fasta`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Path to the supplemental reference file in FASTA format. Only needed if there are additional transgene sequences used in the experiment (only for `--mode wta`).

sample_prefix.description: Type: `string`, default: `sample`. Specify a run name to use as the output file base name
sample_prefix.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `sample`. Specify a run name to use as the output file base name. Use only letters, numbers, or hyphens. Do not use special characters or spaces.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `output_dir/`. Output folder
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `output_dir/`. Output folder. Output still needs to be processed further.

putative_cell_call.description: Type: `string`, example: `mRNA`, choices: ``mRNA`, `AbSeq_Experimental``. Specify the dataset to be used for putative cell calling
putative_cell_call.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `mRNA`, choices: ``mRNA`, `AbSeq_Experimental``. Specify the dataset to be used for putative cell calling. For putative cell calling using an AbSeq dataset, please provide an AbSeq_Reference fasta file above.

exact_cell_count.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. Exact cell count - Set a specific number (>=1) of cells as putative, based on those with the highest error-corrected read count
exact_cell_count.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. Exact cell count - Set a specific number (>=1) of cells as putative, based on those with the highest error-corrected read count

disable_putative_calling.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Disable Refined Putative Cell Calling - Determine putative cells using only the basic algorithm (minimum second derivative along the cumulative reads curve)
disable_putative_calling.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Disable Refined Putative Cell Calling - Determine putative cells using only the basic algorithm (minimum second derivative along the cumulative reads curve). The refined algorithm attempts to remove false positives and recover false negatives, but may not be ideal for certain complex mixtures of cell types. Does not apply if Exact Cell Count is set.

subsample.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.01`. A number >1 or fraction (0 < n < 1) to indicate the number or percentage of reads to subsample
subsample.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.01`. A number >1 or fraction (0 < n < 1) to indicate the number or percentage of reads to subsample.

subsample_seed.description: Type: `integer`, example: `3445`. A seed for replicating a previous subsampled run
subsample_seed.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `3445`. A seed for replicating a previous subsampled run.

sample_tags_version.description: Type: `string`, example: `human`, choices: ``human`, `hs`, `mouse`, `mm``. Specify if multiplexed run
sample_tags_version.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `human`, choices: ``human`, `hs`, `mouse`, `mm``. Specify if multiplexed run.

tag_names.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `4-mySample:9-myOtherSample:6-alsoThisSample`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Tag_Names (optional) - Specify the tag number followed by '-' and the desired sample name to appear in Sample_Tag_Metrics
tag_names.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `4-mySample:9-myOtherSample:6-alsoThisSample`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Tag_Names (optional) - Specify the tag number followed by '-' and the desired sample name to appear in Sample_Tag_Metrics.csv.
Do not use the special characters: &, (), [], {},  <>, ?, |

vdj_version.description: Type: `string`, example: `human`, choices: ``human`, `mouse`, `humanBCR`, `humanBCR`, `humanTCR`, `mouseBCR``. Specify if VDJ run
vdj_version.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `human`, choices: ``human`, `mouse`, `humanBCR`, `humanBCR`, `humanTCR`, `mouseBCR``. Specify if VDJ run.

parallel.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Run jobs in parallel
parallel.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Run jobs in parallel.

timestamps.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Add timestamps to the errors, warnings, and notifications
timestamps.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Add timestamps to the errors, warnings, and notifications.

dryrun.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If true, the output directory will only contain the CWL input files, but the pipeline itself will not be executed
dryrun.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If true, the output directory will only contain the CWL input files, but the pipeline itself will not be executed.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
